displaytitle: Portrait of the Lute Player Giulio Mascheroni
medium: Red chalk, heightened with white chalk over traces of black chalk recto, black chalk verso (illegible sketch), on two pieces of light tan laid paper,  joined near the top of the head
creditline: The John B. Elliott, Class of 1951, Collection
markings: Watermark: GBL in circle, surmounted by three-leaf clover (Bologna, 1712)
inscribed:
Inscribed verso, upper center, in brown ink: Ritratto / di
Annibale Carracci

titles.title: Portrait of the Lute Player Giulio Mascheroni

caption: After Annibale Carracci (1560–1609; born Bologna, Italy; died Rome, Italy), Portrait of the Lute Player Giulio Mascheroni. Red chalk, heightened with white chalk over traces of black chalk recto, black chalk verso (illegible sketch), on two pieces of light tan laid paper,  joined near the top of the head; 39.2 × 27.8 cm. The John B. Elliott, Class of 1951, Collection (1998-439)
